title: Canadian Indian residential school system
summary: In Canada, the Indian residential school system[nb 1] was a network of boarding schools for Indigenous peoples.[nb 2] Attendance was mandatory from 1894 to 1947. The network was funded by the Canadian government's Department of Indian Affairs and administered by Christian churches. The school system was created to isolate Indigenous children from the influence of their own native culture and religion in order to assimilate them into the dominant Canadian culture.[3][4][5]: 42 [6]
